Package oracle.nosql.driver.idcs

This package contains the public API for managing security for the Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud using Oracle's Identity Cloud Service (IDCS).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CredentialsProvider
    CredentialsProvider returns 2 types of IDCSCredentials: Credentials encapsulating user name and password Credentials encapsulating client id and secret These credentials are used by an instance of AccessTokenProvider to acquire access tokens (ATs) for operations.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AccessTokenProvider
    AccessTokenProvider is an implemtnation of AuthorizationProvider that uses access tokens (ATs) obtained from the Oracle Identity Cloud Service (IDCS) as authorization information.
    DefaultAccessTokenProvider
    An instance of AccessTokenProvider that acquires access tokens from Oracle Identity Cloud Service (IDCS) using information provided by a configured CredentialsProvider.
    IDCSCredentials
    A credentials object that bundles a string alias and char array secret used to authenticate with IDCS for token acquisition.
    PropertiesCredentialsProvider
    A CredentialsProvider that fetches credentials stored in a properties file.

Package oracle.nosql.driver.idcs Description

This package contains the public API for managing security for the Oracle NoSQL Database Cloud using Oracle's Identity Cloud Service (IDCS).

All operations require an appropriate OAuth access token (AT) that is used by the system to authorize the operation. Managing IDCS identities and roles is outside of the scope of this documentation. The interfaces and classes in this package are used to provide ATs to the driver for each operation.

It should not be necessary for application to implement any of these interfaces with the possible exception of CredentialsProvider which is used to provide authentication information that is used to acquire access tokens from IDCS.

AccessTokenProvider is the primary interface used to acquire ATs. There are 2 "types" of ATs used by default and they are associated with 2 types of operations:

  1. Account operations and access. These include:
    • Create table
    • Drop table
    • Alter table limits
    • List tables
  2. Service operations and access. These include all data operations and operations that are not account operations
AccessTokenProvider has an interface to acquire each of these.

IDCSCredentials is a simple concrete class to encapsulate authentication information.

CredentialsProvider is a simple interface that abstracts the acquisition of credentials. An application can implement this interface based on information acquired when signing up in the Oracle Cloud, or it can use the default class, PropertiesCredentialsProvider, which acquires this information from a local file (e.g. ~/.andc/credentials).
